image.altText: A woman in a winter coat and glasses.

props.synopsis: A woman accused of murdering her elderly parents by allegedly injecting them with her own medication has been remanded in custody after allegedly breaching her bail conditions on five occasions.

title.children: Woman accused of murdering elderly parents allegedly breaches bail by 'strolling around' shopping centre

image.altText: A smiling blonde woman, Alex, smiles, with beef cattle in the background on her lush paddock.

props.synopsis: A year on from flooding that devastated communities along the River Murray, farmers like Meiqing Lin and Alexandra Westlake are still feeling the impact.

title.children: 'I'm trying to push mothering ewes through': Flood plain farmers reflect on emotional and financial impact of floods

image.altText: A rooster with black, brown and white feathers

props.synopsis: An animal welfare authority is launching an investigation after a bantam rooster was dumped inside a charity bin in Adelaide's south-west.

title.children: Investigation underway after bantam rooster abandoned in charity bin in Adelaide

image.altText: Emergency Management Commissioner Rick Nugent at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Victoria has been battered by heavy rain and flooding, with residents in parts of the towns of Seymour and Yea in the state's centre urged to evacuate. Look back at our coverage.

title.children: Three months of rain in 24hrs: Victoria thrashed by wet weather, emergency evacuations continue

image.altText: Pictures of three women and a man side by side.

props.synopsis: Oppenheimer claims best drama at the Golden Globes as it dominates the film categories, while two Australians score wins.

title.children: Barbie fails to win major Golden Globes as Oppenheimer, Poor Things, Succession shine

image.altText: Emily Blunt smiles on red carpet at Golden Globes

props.synopsis: Awards season is kicking off in Los Angeles as the 81st Golden Globes Awards gets underway, with TV and film stars rocking fancy frocks on the red carpet.

title.children: Golden Globes red carpet: Superstar Barbie, gothic chic and pops of colour  — see all the looks

image.altText: Inside a plane oxygen masks hang from the roof above empty seats near a large hole in the side of the aircraft. A runway outside

props.synopsis: People in the city of Portland were asked to look out for a door 'plug' after a blowout on a Boeing 737 MAX 9. It was found in a teacher's backyard.

title.children: A Boeing plane's door 'plug' has been found in a backyard after a mid-air blowout. Here's what we know

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: Emma Stone poses with her Golden Globe

props.synopsis: Here is the full winners list from the Golden Globes, where Barbie missed out on the biggest gongs as Oppenheimer and Poor Things staked their claims for the rest of awards season.

title.children: Golden Globes winners list: Margot misses out, but Sarah Snook, Elizabeth Debicki take home awards

image.altText: Kathy Claxton needs opioids like Sevredol

props.synopsis: Doctors hold growing concerns about a significant shortage of opioid pain medicines given to some of the sickest Australians.

title.children: 'Health crisis' looming as series of pain relief opioid medications discontinued

image.altText: Alice Springs Correctional Facility seen from the air.

props.synopsis: Corrections Commissioner Matthew Varley says an immediate review will be held into the riot, which is the second incident at the prison in a fortnight.

title.children: Beds burnt, doors smashed down in riot involving 27 inmates at Alice Springs prison

image.altText: A silhouette of domestic violence victim Jane

props.synopsis: A Sydney woman wins a lengthy court battle to clear her name after being charged with assaulting her husband, who she claims was abusing her.

title.children: Jane reported her husband for domestic violence. Days later police charged her with assault

image.altText: A plane rests upside down after crashing.

props.synopsis: Several people are being treated after a light plane crashed while landing on remote Lizard Island.

title.children: Several people injured in Great Barrier Reef island plane crash

subjects.title: Air and Space Accidents and Incidents

image.altText: A black car does a burnout within metres of people.

props.synopsis: An ACT police officer describes some Summernats festival attendees as a "sub-species of the human race" following a weekend of incidents across the capital.

title.children: 'Moron tourism': ACT police slam behaviour of some Summernats attendees following multiple incidents over weekend

image.altText: Water over a road in regional Victoria.

props.synopsis: Residents in parts of Rochester in Victoria's north are urged to evacuate with flooding expected overnight and into tomorrow, following similar warnings in the state's centre earlier today.

title.children: More evacuation warnings issued in Victoria amid record rainfall

image.altText: A woman wearing white and black work wear and red glasses reclines on an office chair in a bright office, her feet on the desk.

props.synopsis: They're the people who are charismatic, friendly and, above all, the social glue that holds the office together. And social media has a new name for them: "personality hires".

title.children: What it means to be the 'personality hire' at work

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has finished lower on the first day of trade for the week despite Wall Street finishing on a positive note, after Core Lithium fell by more than 17 per cent.

title.children: ASX finishes lower as Core Lithium dives, US jobs data dampens hopes of early rate cuts — as it happened

image.altText: Two Matildas players celebrate a goal during the FIFA Women's World Cup.

props.synopsis: She's become one of the most prolific goalscorers in women's football. But as Sam Kerr's ACL injury shows, that superhuman effort comes at a human cost, writes Samantha Lewis.

title.children: Sam Kerr's ACL injury reminds us of the human within the superhuman career

image.altText: A soccer player wearing yellow and green and pink shoes runs during a game

props.synopsis: Kerr ruptures an ACL while in a mid-season training camp with Chelsea and is unlikely to play at the Paris Olympics if the Matildas earn qualification.

title.children: Matildas captain Sam Kerr suffers 'devastating' ACL injury six months out from Olympics

image.altText: The allegedly stolen car was tracked and brought to a stop at Carseldine.

props.synopsis: Queensland police allege the car was stolen from Bardon on Saturday and tracked to Carseldine, where the teenagers were arrested later that night.

title.children: Four Brisbane teens, including 15-year-old girl, charged after live streaming alleged joy ride in stolen car

image.altText: A korean soldier looks out from a concrete viewing post

props.synopsis: From a brutal axe murder to a defector making a desperate escape for freedom in a hail of bullets, these are just a few of the violent incidents that have occurred in the DMZ.

title.children: Axe murders and an assassin squad: Why this part of Korea is the 'scariest place on Earth'

image.altText: Feral goat in rocky bushland.

props.synopsis: A flock of feral goats causing safety issues on a busy highway north of Hobart has resulted in three government agencies passing the buck on what to do — with a council manager admitting he is "aware this sounds a bit ridiculous".

title.children: Goat flock near highway sparks 'ridiculous' bureaucratic buck-passing

image.altText: A brown snake with its tongue out on a rock

props.synopsis: There is no shortage of snakes this summer, or ideas on how to avoid them — especially from so-called experts on social media — but those in the field say one simple action might be the most effective of all.

title.children: With summer comes snake season and all sorts of safety ideas, but one simple strategy tops the lot

image.altText: Mohamed Muizzu stands in a suit next to a flag

props.synopsis: The three Maldives deputy ministers labelled Narendra Modi a "clown", "terrorist" and a "puppet of Israel", leading to prominent Indians calling for compatriots to boycott holidaying in the archipelago.

title.children: Maldives suspends three deputy ministers for calling Indian PM 'a clown' and 'a terrorist'

image.altText: Images of a snake, lizards and a larger monitor lizard in separate containers

props.synopsis: NSW Police dismantle a criminal syndicate allegedly trying to export hundreds of native Australian lizards and reptiles to Hong Kong.

title.children: 'Cold-blooded and cruel': Police seize native reptiles worth up to $1.2m being sent overseas

image.altText: Australian tennis player Alex de Minaur points at the court as he talks during a United Cup match.

props.synopsis: Former world number one Pat Rafter has endorsed the new and improved Alex de Minaur as an Australian Open final contender after the 24-year-old's rise to world number 10.

title.children: Former world number one backs De Minaur to improve 'surprising' major record with finals appearances

image.altText: Headshot of a man with a bush background.

props.synopsis: Karl O'Callaghan is urging the state's director of liquor licensing to consider a police proposal to restrict the sale of alcohol in more regional areas, warning "children's lives at stake".

title.children: Former police boss backs call for more liquor restrictions in regional WA, saying 'this is a statewide problem'

image.altText: A close-up image of a man's face taken from a social media video.

props.synopsis: Jordan Kenyon, the unlicensed driver of a car involved in a fatal collision near Geelong which killed a 12-year-old girl, is remanded in custody.

title.children: Unlicensed driver faces court over Victorian crash which killed 12yo

image.altText: Helicopter flies over snow on mountain

props.synopsis: The avalanche, at a height of around 2,200 metres, swept away the pair, who were wearing snowshoes to navigate the mountains.

title.children: Two hikers on outing with their dog killed by Italian Alps avalanche

image.altText: Several people stand amongst piles of rubble.

props.synopsis: Three months on from the conflict, Western diplomats are trying to prevent the war from spreading, despite Israel continuing with its military campaign.

title.children: Conflict in Gaza intensifies as Western diplomats seek ways to prevent war from spreading in Middle East

image.altText: People stand before an artwork featuring red curtains in front of an even larger artwork of red curtains.

props.synopsis: Ten artists were tasked with getting to know the communities in regional Western Australia and produce artwork that both challenged and reflected the places they visited. Here's what they came back with.

title.children: As more people move to the regions looking for a new life, these artists went bush in search of utopia
